channel.title: Math help
channel.description:
i learned this some years ago and now i forgot, we are just doing a review so i don't understand it if you can
help that be great.
the question is g(t)= 3t-2
where g(t)= g(13)-g(7) ---------- 13-7
if you can just solve and explain briefly it be great.
i feel bad about creating this thread just for one question.

item.title: Math help
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:3, topic:71480”]if you set in 1 in g and t you will get right answer.
If g(t) = g * t[/quote]

Rofl, i nearly pissed my pants reading that utter bullshit.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 27, 2007, 09:44:27 AM[/size][hr][quote=“SETO, post:1, topic:71480”]i learned this some years ago and now i forgot, we are just doing a review so i don’t understand it if you can

help that be great.

the question is g(t)= 3t-2

where g(t)= g(13)-g(7)
----------
13-7

if you can just solve and explain briefly it be great.

i feel bad about creating this thread just for one question.[/quote]

g(13)-g(7)
---------- = 3t-2
13-7

6g= 18t- 12

g = 3t - 2

thats it in simplest form

to work out where it intersects the axiz sub g for 0 then t for 0

When g= 0 t =2/3
When t = 0 g=-2

Read full topic

@bowserjr2 wrote:

if you set in 1 in g and t you will get right answer.
If g(t) = g * t

item.title: Math help
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Unless I am mistaken, that looks like the slope formula. Δy / Δx. However, that does not equal g(t). Note that Δy = y2 - y1 = g(x2) - g(x1, since y = g(x)

m = Δy / Δx

m = [g(13) - g(7)] / [13 - 7]

m = [(3(13) - 2} - (3(7) - 2)] / 6

m = [37 - 19] / 6

m = 18 / 6 = 3

Hope that’s what you needed

Read full topic
